title.narrative: Sudan - contribution to clearance of arrears to the IMF

description.narrative:
As a prerequisite for receiving debt relief through the Heavily Indebted Poor Countries (HIPC) Initiative, Sudan must clear its arrears to the International Financial Institutions. The International Financial Institutions have conditioned their contribution to the HIPC on full compensation for their cost of this, which donors have agreed to cover. For three countries who all had large arrears to the IMF (Liberia, Somalia and Sudan), it was agreed that donors would contribute to the arrears clearance process when the countries approached the HIPC Decision Point. Denmark contributes to clearing Sudan's arrears to IMF through Denmark’s share of so-called “membership contributions” in IMF.
The development objective is to support stabilization and development in Sudan through reinforcement of the financial underpinnings of the exercise of core government functions at the central and decentral level. The actual support will be based on progress achieved by Sudan in meeting the preconditions for treatment under the HIPC initiative as described above.
